offlabel-antrag.attachmentsFreeText.help: One attachment per line, e.g. doctor letter, findings, lab results.
offlabel-antrag.fields.export.includeSou: Adds the relevant references to the export.
offlabel-antrag.export.defaults.noSeveri: No dedicated severity values are currently documented.
offlabel-antrag.export.defaults.medicati: Please select a medication from the list to include the medication-specific rationale block.
offlabel-antrag.export.severity.bell: My functional level is Bell score {{bellScore}}.
offlabel-antrag.export.severity.gdb: A disability degree (GdB) of {{gdb}} is documented{{marker}}.
offlabel-antrag.export.severity.pflegegr: A nursing care level of {{pflegegrad}} is in place.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.subject: Application for case-by-case cost coverage (off-label use): {{drug}}
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p1: I hereby request case-by-case cost coverage for a prescribed off-label use of {{drugName}} (active substance: {{drugSubstance}}) to treat symptoms related to {{diagnosisMain}}.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p2: The condition causes a persistent and substantial impairment of quality of life and daily functioning: {{severitySummary}}. Supporting evidence is listed in the attachments.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p3: No causal therapy is currently available. Care is predominantly symptom-oriented; established measures were exhausted where possible, were insufficient, or were not tolerated (see “Previous treatment approaches”).
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p4: Based on a summary review, the requested off-label use meets the criteria described in case law and Medical Service appraisal standards (including serious disease, missing standard therapy/no sufficient alternative, and a justified prospect of treatment benefit).
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p5: Additionally, in severe disease courses with missing sufficient standard options, case-by-case coverage under Section 2(1a) SGB V may be considered.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p7: Target symptoms addressed by this request: {{targetSymptoms}}.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p9: I kindly request a timely written decision. My treating practice can provide additional information if required.
offlabel-antrag.export.medication.agomel: In the assessment of the Expert Group Long COVID Off-Label Use at BfArM, agomelatine is described as an option for depressive symptoms and/or sleep disorders related to long/post-COVID.
Planned dosing follows the expert-group assessment (e.g. 25 mg in the evening; escalation to 50 mg where clinically indicated).
Monitoring: liver values according to product information/recommendations; review adverse effects and interactions.
offlabel-antrag.export.medication.ivabra: In the assessment of the Expert Group Long COVID Off-Label Use at BfArM, ivabradine is described as an option in post-infectious PoTS (long/post-COVID), especially when beta blockers are not tolerated or not suitable.
Planned dosing follows the expert-group assessment: initial 2.5 mg in the morning; escalation in 2.5 mg steps up to 5 mg twice daily (with pulse control in supine and standing position).
Monitoring: pulse/blood pressure, ECG where indicated; review interactions/contraindications. Pregnancy is contraindicated.
offlabel-antrag.export.medication.vortio: In the assessment of the Expert Group Long COVID Off-Label Use at BfArM, vortioxetine is described as an option for depressive symptoms and/or cognitive impairment related to long/post-COVID.
Planned dosing follows the expert-group assessment: initial 5 mg daily; increase to 10 mg daily after one week; maximum 20 mg daily. Evaluate effectiveness after about 12 weeks.
Note: clarify local availability/import where required. Monitoring: adverse effects/interactions and follow-up with symptom scoring.
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.subject: Cover letter regarding the off-label request (part 1) - request for support
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.p1: Please find attached my letter to the health insurer (part 1: request for off-label cost coverage). I kindly ask for your support so the request is medically comprehensible and decision-ready.
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.p2: A short medical statement (1-2 paragraphs) referencing part 1 would be particularly helpful:
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.supportBull: - prior treatment attempts and why no adequate standard option exists
- planned dosing, monitoring, and benefit-risk assessment
- where relevant, why waiting may lead to significant deterioration
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.p3: I kindly ask you to support the request from part 1 by preparing a short medical statement/findings report. Ideal content includes diagnosis, severity/functional level, prior measures, missing standard therapy, and your medical assessment of the requested off-label therapy (benefit-risk, monitoring, treatment goal). A pre-formulated draft is included below and can be adopted or adapted.
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.statement.h: DRAFT - Medical statement supporting an off-label request (please transfer to practice letterhead)
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.statement.p: I, {{doctorName}}, confirm treatment of {{patientName}}, date of birth {{patientBirthDate}}. Diagnoses: {{diagnosisMain}} (ICD where available: {{diagnosisIcdList}}). Leading symptoms/exertion intolerance: {{targetSymptoms}}.
The disease burden is clinically relevant: {{severitySummary}} Functional capacity is clearly reduced (e.g. {{severityHighlights}}).

A causal, generally accepted standard therapy is currently not available for this clinical picture; care is mainly symptom-oriented. Prior measures/treatments (excerpt): {{priorTreatments}}. Relevant disease burden remains despite prior measures.

For symptomatic treatment, off-label therapy with {{drugName}} ({{drugSubstance}}) is requested, treatment goal: {{targetSymptoms}}. The indication rationale references the documentation of the Expert Group Long COVID Off-Label Use at BfArM.
Dosage proposal: {{doseText}} Treatment duration/trial: {{durationText}} Stop criteria: {{stopText}} Monitoring/safety: {{monitoringText}}

From a medical perspective there is a plausible prospect of meaningful positive impact on symptom burden. Alternative standard options are exhausted or unavailable in this individual case. Off-label prescribing is planned as a time-limited trial with defined stop criteria and monitoring.
offlabel-antrag.export.statement.medicat: Please define dosage in the final medical statement.
Please define trial duration in the final medical statement.
Please define stop criteria in the final medical statement.
Please define monitoring and safety checks in the final medical statement.
Standard dosage 25 mg in the evening; if no symptom improvement after 4 weeks, increase to 50 mg in the evening.
Treatment duration between 2 weeks and 3 months (stop if no improvement); continue longer only when there is clear benefit.
Stop treatment if transaminases exceed 3x upper normal limit and/or there are clinical signs of liver injury; stop during pregnancy.
Liver function tests before start and during treatment according to product information; continuous benefit-risk review.
Initial 2.5 mg twice daily; after 2 weeks increase to 5 mg twice daily if symptoms persist and resting pulse is >= 60/min.
Reduce dose or stop when resting pulse is < 50/min or bradycardia symptoms occur; stop when no pulse reduction and no clinical improvement are achieved.
Monitor resting pulse and blood pressure; ECG monitoring as clinically required.
Initial 5 mg once daily; after 2 weeks increase to 10 mg once daily when response is insufficient; reduce back to 5 mg if not tolerated.
Stop treatment when there is no clinical improvement or severe adverse effects occur (e.g. serotonin syndrome signs).
Clinical monitoring of adverse effects, tolerability and efficacy; consider interaction and serotonergic risk.
offlabel-antrag.fields.export.includeSec: Adds an extra paragraph for Section 2(1a) SGB V and includes the LSG source.
offlabel-antrag.export.sources.md: MD Bund, appraisal guide "Hinweise zum Off-Label-Use", status 2024-06-24.
offlabel-antrag.export.sources.expert.iv: Expert Group Long COVID Off-Label Use at BfArM: ivabradine assessment (status 2025-11-10).
offlabel-antrag.export.sources.expert.vo: Expert Group Long COVID Off-Label Use at BfArM: vortioxetine assessment (status 2025-11-10).
offlabel-antrag.export.sources.expert.ag: Expert Group Long COVID Off-Label Use at BfArM: agomelatine assessment (status 2025-12-08).
offlabel-antrag.export.sources.lsg: LSG Niedersachsen-Bremen, interim decision on ME/CFS and Section 2(1a) SGB V.
